ratings.comment: Michael truly is a caring and dedicated instructor. While taking AH 355, I was suffering from a severe mental health crisis, and he was always more than happy to meet in office hours/correspond via email while I was struggling. He helped me thrive in AH 355 despite all of my personal struggles, and I am thankful to have been in his class.

Michael is one of the hardest professors I have worked with. He expects you to do the dense readings and be able to write about them. However, he is also the only professor who actually taught me how to write an essay. He is also the only one who actually reads what I wrote and gave me feedback. Do not take him if you are hoping for an easy A.

The more you put into his classes the more you will get out. I was pretty motivated to learn abut art, so I got a lot out of his class. He helped me not only become a better writer but to also become more confident in my abilities as a student. I'd take him again in a second. Oh, and you will get an A if you try and show improvement.

Michael is great. He is the only guy who will read over drafts and sit with you to make an outline. He cares about what you think and accepts disagreement. Be prepared to speak in class and challenge yourself. He probably isnt for you if you just want to do the bare minimum.

Everything "oscillates and what not" for Michael---most of us had no clue what he was talking about. He is a nice guy, but a little too full of himself. A bit on a power trip--he acts as if he was a professor already. Brags about his accomplishments too much. Pretty annoying most of the time.
This is best early morning class Ive taken. Hes so passionate and smart about art. UW is very lucky to have him.

He expects you to actually participate and expects you to improve in writing. He will make you work for an A, but he will also help you get it. I don't think I've ever had anyone as passionate as him - not only about his teaching area, but also about for seeing students improve. He taught me how to write. He's a blast and also hilarious.

Michael is smart and nice. We got very little room for discussion since he likes to talk a lot--especially about himself. He comes off as trying too hard, probably because he is trying to make up for being and looking so young.

Michael is one of the only TA's that I've had who genuinely cares for the learning of his students. He always is willing to meet with students who need help, and when papers are due, he always reads rough draft submissions and gives very good, extensive feedback quickly. He makes this tough course a lot more bearable.

He made me want to become a major! He oozes enthusiasm and could make a wad of toilet paper seem interesting. He is more than willing to help (do send him rough drafts and he'll give you rapid and thorough feedback). Don't miss his office hours! He genuinely loves meeting with students.
